headline.main: FRANCE.; MILITARY MOVEMENTS AND PREPARATIONS. Personal, Literary and Miscellaneous Gossip.

docs.lead_paragraph: I am in a position to say to-day that the French Government, having recognized the in sufficiency of its preparations for the task it has undertaken, is silently making such additions to its armaments as circumstances will allow.
docs.snippet: I am in a position to say to-day that the French Government, having recognized the in sufficiency of its preparations for the task it has undertaken, is silently making such additions to its armaments as circumstances will allow.

byline.original: Special Correspondence to the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. WADE presented petitions against the Nebraska bill. Mr. SUMNER presented several series of resolutions of the Legislature of Massachusetts--among them one recommending the granting of pensions to :he survivors of the War of 1812, and against allowing the Amistad claim. Mr. WALKER presented the proceedings of a public meeting in Philadelphia, in favor of the Homestead bill.

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE ATLANTIC. INTERESTING FROM THE SET OF WAR. Bombardment of Odessa by the British Fleet. DEFEAT OF THE GREEK INSURGENTS. Retreat of the Russians from WaUachia. FALL IN COTTON AND FLOUR. Loss of an Emigrant Vessel. ONE HUNDRED AND EIGHTY LIVES LOST. THE WAR. The Danube--Retreat of the Russians from Little Wallachia. The Siege of Silistria. Other Incidents of the War. The Baltic. An Amusing Story. Latest from the Seat of War--Evacuation of Lesser Wallachia by the Russians. The Bombardment of Odessa. The New Vienna Protocol. GREAT BRITAIN. The Trade with Russia--Duties of Neutral Powers. FROM SPAIN. Relations of Spain and the United States. PRUSSIA. The Recall of Chevalier Bunsen--Its Reasons--It is Sucessor. Marriage of the Emperor of Austria--Imposing Ceremonies. Dr. Cumming on the Struggle in the East. The Exact Position of the German Powers. Personal Appearance of the Czar. The Darien Exploring Expedition.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the United States Mail steamer Atlantic, which arrived yesterday at 2 P. M., we have four days later news from all parts of Europe. The war news is interesting. The Atlantic has 82 passengers. The Cunard Mail steamer Europa arrived at Liverpool, midnight of Sunday, April 30. The screw-steamer Great Britain, from Liverpool, 29th April, for Australia, had returned to Liverpool having burst a flue off Holyhead.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Aldermen met soon after 5 o'clock, and proceeded to business immediately. STREET CLEANING. The subect of cleaning the streets came up on a petition asking that the manner of giving out the contracts be investigated. headline.main: News from Utah--Sufferings of Col. Fremom's Party.

docs.lead_paragraph: Editor of the Salt Lake News: ?? SIR-- I left Parowan Feb. 20, and arrived in this city on the first day or March, in company with President HENRY LUNT. Co. JAMES A. LITTLE. Major J. D. LEE, SAMUEL WEST JAMES H. MARTINEAU, SILAS and ?? SMITH, and others. We arrived in safety.
